title: In 1984, a Canadian farmer began renting advertising space on his cows.
Butterflies cannot fly if their body temperature is less than 86 degrees.
It's impossible to sneeze with your eyes open.
Ithyphallophobia' is a morbid fear of seeing, thinking about or having an erect penis.
EMI stands for ' Electrical and Musical Instruments'.
A group of finches is called a Charm.
A quarter of Russia is covered by forest.
$203,000,000 is spent on barbed wire each year in the U.S.
Mercury is the only planet whose orbit is coplanar with its equator.
Human thigh bones are stronger than concrete.

In England during Queen Victoria's reign, it was illegal to be a homosexual but not a lesbian. The reason being that when the Queen was approving the law she wouldn't believe that women would do that.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds
It is illegal to hunt camels in the state of Arizona.
There are approximately 100 million acts of sexual intercourse each day.
Rubber bands last longer when refrigerated.
Starfish have no brains.
Research indicates that mosquitos are attracted to people who have recently eaten bananas.
It takes more calories to eat a piece of celery than the celery has in it to begin with.
A camel's backbone is just as straight as a horse's.
Al Capone’s business card said he was a used furniture dealer.
Leonardo Da Vinci invented the scissors, the helicopter, and many other present day items.
All polar bears are left-handed.
Switzerland is the only country with a square flag.
Honey is the only natural food that is made without destroying any kind of life.
99% of the solar system mass is concentrated in the sun.
Women blink nearly twice as much as men.
The U.S. Post Office handles 43 percent of the world’s mail.
There are more beetles than any other animal. In fact, one out of every four animals is a beetle.
In 2017, a United Nations official investigating poverty in the United States, stated that Alabama had the worst poverty in the entire developed world.
Ketchup was sold in the 1830s as medicine.
If you keep a goldfish in the dark room, it will eventually turn white.
Vancouver, Canada has the least affordable housing in North America, more expensive than Manhattan and San Francisco
Clouds fly higher during the day than the night.
The only 2 patients to be cured of HIV were also undergoing cancer treatment at the same time; meaning they became cancer free AND HIV negative at the same time.
An Olympic gold medal must contain 92.5 percent silver
A sizable oak tree, during the typical growing season, gives off 28,000 gallons of moisture.
11% of the world is left-handed.
Antarctica is the only continent that does not have land areas below sea level.
1,800 cigarettes are smoked per person each year in China.
Bacteria, the tiniest free-living cells, are so small that a single drop of liquid contains as many as 50 million of them.
A woodchuck breathes only 10 times in hibernation.
Christmas was once illegal in England.
A lion's roar can be heard from five miles away.
Antarctica is the only continent on which no Lepidoptera have been found.
The past-tense of the English word 'dare' is 'durst'
On average people fear spiders more than they do death.
10% of the people account for 60% of sales of alcoholic beverages
A 2' X 4' is really 1-1/2' by 3-1/2'.
A woman once jumped from the 86th floor of the Empire State Building but only fell one story before a freak gust of wind swept her onto a ledge. She was rescued shortly after.
When sharks take a bite, their eyes roll back and their teeth jut out.
Most insects are beneficial to people because they eat other insects, pollinate crops, are food for other animals, make products we use (like honey and silk) or have medical uses.
Shakespeare invented the word 'assassination' and 'bump.'
Egyptian pharoahs used slaves to keep away bugs
A chameleon's tongue is twice the length of its body.
For every 230 cars that are made, 1 will be stolen.
Netherlands is the only country with a national dog.
The man who voiced Tigger from "Winnie the Pooh" was the first to invent an artificial heart
There are about 24,000 species of butterflies. The moths are even more numerous: about 140,000 species of them were counted all over the world.

The record for fastest manmade object is a manhole cover launched by a nuclear bomb. A high-speed camera recording the lid only caught one frame of it moving, meaning it was traveling over 125,000 miles per hour.
A fierce gust of wind blew 45 year old Vittorio Luise's car into a rover near Naples, Italy, in 1980. He managed to break a window, climb out and swim to shore--where a tree blew over and killed him.
Movie theatre popcorn is sold at a 1275% markup!

Legendary musician Prince passed away leaving no will detailing how to distribute his multi-million dollar estate. Within 3 weeks of his death, more than 700 people claimed to be his half-sibling or descendant.
Fur seals get miserably sick when they're carried aboard ships.
God is the only one in the Simpsons with five fingers.
A single sheeps fleece might well contain as many as 26 million fibres.
In 1933, Mickey Mouse, an animated cartoon character, received 800,000 fan letters.
It was once against the law to have a pet dog in a city in Iceland.
Bees have 5 eyes. There are 3 small eyes on the top of a bee's head and 2 larger ones in front.

April is Earthquake Preparedness month. For a little added incentive, consider this- The most powerful earthquake to strike the United States occurred in 1811 in New Madrid, Missouri. The quake shook more than one million square miles, and was felt as far as 1,000 miles away.
If you go blind in one eye you only lose about one fifth of your vision but all your sense of depth.
US gold coins used to say 'In Gold We Trust'.
Every year 4 people in the UK die putting their trousers on.
All the swans in England are property of the Queen.
A duck's quack doesn't echo, and no one knows why.
Because of the salt content of the Dead Sea, it is difficult to dive below its surface.
The people of Israel consume more turkeys per capita than any other country.
98% of all murders and rapes are by a close family member or friend of the victim.
Approximately 1/3 of the Earth's land surface is desert.
Flamingos can only eat with their heads upside down.
A cat uses its whiskers to determine if a space is too small to squeeze through.
At the nearest point, Russia and America are less than 4 km apart.
It's illegal to spit on the sidewalk in Norfolk, Virginia.
Greece's national anthem has 158 verses.
You're born with 300 bones, but by the time you become an adult, you only have 206.
The human feet perspire half a pint of fluid a day
A full moon is nine times brighter than a half moon.
The name Wendy was made up for the book Peter Pan. There was never a recorded Wendy before it.

Ever wonder where the term Work Smarter...Not Harder originated? Allan F. Mogensen, the creator of Work Simplification, coined the phrase in the 1930's. The 1990's equivalent term is probably Business Process Reengineering.
Entomophobia is the fear of insects.
Arachibutyrophobia is the fear of peanut butter sticking to the roof of your mouth.
Termites have been known to eat food twice as fast when heavy metal music is playing.
At birth a panda is smaller than a mouse and weighs about four ounces.
A normal raindrop falls at about 7 miles per hour.
I is the most spoken word in the English language
A castrated male reindeer is called a bull.
Rugby, North Dakota is the geographical center of North America.
In 10 minutes, a hurricane releases more energy than all of the world's nuclear weapons combined.
Certain fireflies emit a light so penetrating that it can pass through flesh and wood.
The glue on Israeli postage is certified kosher.
